channel.title: [delta] ice barrage
channel.description: If you cast ice barrage on someone that player should be frozen at THAT moment. but if that player was walking somewhere it just continues walking to it, when the player is there he's frozen. So were do i add walkto(0,0)

I’m not really sure, you should out.printin it to see where is it, and im also pretty sure that the walking packet is the 210

item.title: [delta] ice barrage
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

just use the entangle delay method.
or try a timer?

import those

import java.util.Timer;
import java.util.TimerTask;

now you can use this for your timed task

 public void demoDelayedTask() {
                Timer timer = new Timer();
                int delayTime = 2000; // Milliseconds to wait before running delayed task
                
                timer.schedule(new TimerTask() {
                        @Override
                        public void run() {
						yell(" make sure to check ::rules and ::help ");
                                System.out.println("Delayed task has been run.");
                                System.out.println("Current time: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
                        }                        
                }, delayTime);
        }

or just use entangle delay :

                walkto(0, -1);
		EntangleDelay = 1000;

Read full topic
